name: Transmission
desc: A collection of games made with raylib

options.name: credentialsFile
options.desc: Path to a JSON file to be merged with the settings. Useful to merge afile which is better kept out of the Nix store to set secret configparameters like  rpc-password .

options.name: downloadDirPermissions
options.desc: If not  null , is used as the permissions set by system.activationScripts.transmission-daemon  on thedirectories  services.transmission.settings.download-dir , services.transmission.settings.incomplete-dir .and  services.transmission.settings.watch-dir .Note that you may also want to change  services.transmission.settings.umask .

options.name: enable
options.desc: Whether to enable the headless Transmission BitTorrent daemon.  Transmission daemon can be controlled via the RPC interface usingtransmission-remote, the WebUI ( http://127.0.0.1:9091/  by default), orother clients like stig or tremc.  Torrents are downloaded to  services.transmission.home /Downloadsby default and are accessible to users in the “transmission” group.

options.name: extraFlags
options.desc: Extra flags passed to the transmission command in the servicedefinition.

options.name: group
options.desc: Group account under which Transmission runs.

options.name: home
options.desc: The directory where Transmission will create .config/transmission-daemon . as well as Downloads/  unless  services.transmission.settings.download-dir is changed, and  .incomplete/  unless  services.transmission.settings.incomplete-dir is changed.

options.name: openFirewall
options.desc: Alias of  services.transmission.openPeerPorts .

options.name: openPeerPorts
options.desc: Whether to enable opening of the peer port(s) in the firewall.

options.name: openRPCPort
options.desc: Whether to enable opening of the RPC port in the firewall.

options.name: package
options.desc: The transmission package to use.

options.name: performanceNetParameters
options.desc: Whether to enable tweaking of kernel parameters to open many moreconnections at the same time.  Note that you may also want to increase peer-limit-global . And be aware that these settings arequite aggressive and might not suite your regular desktop use. Forinstance, SSH sessions may time out more easily.

options.name: settings
options.desc: Settings whose options overwrite fields in .config/transmission-daemon/settings.json  (each time theservice starts).  See  Transmission’sWiki  for documentation of settings not explicitly covered by thismodule.

options.name: settings.download-dir
options.desc: Directory where to download torrents.

options.name: settings.incomplete-dir
options.desc: When enabled with services.transmission.home  services.transmission.settings.incomplete-dir-enabled ,new torrents will download the files to this directory. When complete,the files will be moved to download-dir  services.transmission.settings.download-dir .

options.name: settings.message-level
options.desc: Set verbosity of transmission messages.

options.name: settings.peer-port
options.desc: The peer port to listen for incoming connections.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: settings.peer-port-random-high
options.desc: The maximum peer port to listen to for incoming connections when  services.transmission.settings.peer-port-random-on-start is enabled.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: settings.peer-port-random-low
options.desc: The minimal peer port to listen to for incoming connections when  services.transmission.settings.peer-port-random-on-start is enabled.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: settings.peer-port-random-on-start
options.desc: Randomize the peer port.

options.name: settings.rpc-bind-address
options.desc: Where to listen for RPC connections. Use  0.0.0.0  tolisten on all interfaces.

options.name: settings.rpc-port
options.desc: The RPC port to listen to.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: settings.script-torrent-done-enabled
options.desc: Whether to run  services.transmission.settings.script-torrent-done-filename at torrent completion.

options.name: settings.script-torrent-done-filename
options.desc: Executable to be run at torrent completion.

options.name: settings.trash-original-torrent-files
options.desc: Whether to delete torrents added from the  services.transmission.settings.watch-dir .

options.name: settings.umask
options.desc: Sets transmission’s file mode creation mask. See the umask(2) manpagefor more information. Users who want their saved torrents to beworld-writable may want to set this value to 0. Bear in mind that thejson markup language only accepts numbers in base 10, so the standardumask(2) octal notation “022” is written in settings.json as 18.

options.name: settings.utp-enabled
options.desc: Whether to enable  MicroTransport Protocol (µTP) .

options.name: settings.watch-dir
options.desc: Watch a directory for torrent files and add them to transmission.

options.name: settings.watch-dir-enabled
options.desc: Whether to enable the  services.transmission.settings.watch-dir .

options.name: user
options.desc: User account under which Transmission runs.

options.name: webHome
options.desc: If not  null , sets the value of the TRANSMISSION_WEB_HOME  environment variable used by theservice. Useful for overriding the web interface files, withoutoverriding the transmission package and thus requiring rebuilding itlocally. Use this if you want to use an alternative web interface, suchas  pkgs.flood-for-transmission .
